text: Vik Lalić (born 9 February 1976) is a retired Croatian football player who played as a defender. He is currently a coach of NK Croatia Zmijavci. He started his career at Hajduk Split in 1996 before moving to Rot-Weiß Oberhausen in Germany in 2001. The following season he returned to Hajduk, transferring to NK Solin in 2005 before finally moving to Neuchâtel Xamax in 2006. He was champion of the Croatian First League with Hajduk in 2001, 2004 and 2005. ==References== Category:1976 births Category:Living people Category:People from Makarska Category:Croatian footballers Category:Croatian expatriate footballers Category:Croatian First Football League players Category:HNK Hajduk Split players Category:NK Zadar players Category:Rot-Weiß Oberhausen players Category:NK Solin players Category:NK Mosor players Category:Neuchâtel Xamax FCS players Category:Expatriate footballers in Germany Category:Expatriate footballers in Switzerland Category:HNK Hajduk Split non-playing staff Category:Association football defenders
title: Vik Lalić
